text: Bottle 300716. Golden color with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, pine, grapefruit. Flavor is fruit, malt, hop, citrus, pine, grapefruit, grass. Nice beer.

Nice hazed golden color with a fine white head. Nice lacing. Looks good and inviting. Good intensity in the aroma. Medium body and a fine carbonation. Good balance between sweetness and bitterness. Citric, pine, and fruity flavor. Flavor last a long time! Lovely and very session able ale. Can not fine anything wrong with it.[Bottle from a trade with gunnar]

A really nice summer season beer! Bright golden color with a snow white head. Aromas of apricots. Nice balance and good bitterness for being a "low ABV IPA". I wish this beer was available all year round!

Had this beer several times. Pours clear and golden with a white head. As a fresh ale, under two weeks old, aromas was dominated by citrus fruits. As the beer "matured" the aroma fainted a bit and left it with a really nice apricot character. Flavors also became more balanced. A really sessionable beer!

Dufter humle, citrus, tropisk frukt
Gyllen, med tynt hvitt skum
Balansert med dominant humle og preg av tropisk frukt
Balansert og lett samtidig spennede nok, fin sommerøl.

Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, grass and hints of honey and cereal. Golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium + bitter. Medium body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall a nice, refreshing Session IPA
How : tap Appearance : clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma : tropical fruits, citrus peel, grass, honey and flowers. Palate : medium to light body, average carbonation.

33 cl, bottle fermented. Light yellowish amber, some chill haze, thin white head, low carbonation. Aroma is loaded with hops. Mouthfeel is well carbonated, but a bit short. Taste is nice and hoppy, but I wish it had a bit more bittering. Very refreshing, must be the perfect rock festival beer, I could easily drink several of these, beeing a weekend warrior in a muddy field on a hot day. Amarillo and Mosaic goes together really well.

Draught. Low white head. Hoppy and fruity aroma, very dominant. Light in color and moderate clear. Smooth bitterness and a very pleasant hop character. Troipical fruit, citrus, some resin. No push back. Very, very drinkable. All about the hops, just enought malt to back it (somewhat) up. Moderate carbonation lends to the drinkability.

On tap at Bøker & Børst, Stavanger. Pours hazy golden with a small white head.Strong fruity aroma, peach mango and citrus. Taste is crisp and juicy fruits, light mineralic bitterness, lots of citrus and mango in this one, high carbonated. Lingering fruity finish with a nice minty bite. Late hops all the way.

Fra fat på Bøker og Børst: lys gyllen med fint skum som varer. Deilig citrusaroma og -smak med grapefrukt, citron, honning og bare et snev av gress. Tørr og fin avslutning gjør denne til en god og meget lettdrikkelig festivaløl.

Lukt: Citrus og honning.
Utseende: Gulbrun.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Citrus og honning, liten beisk avslutning.

0,33l bottle. 2016. Lovely hoppy aroma. Cloudy and golden with off-white medium head. Fantastic aroma. Hint of pineapple. Sweet. Lightly carbonated. Could have been more carbonated. Mild taste. Very pleasant, but more bitterness would have lifted it further.

Bottle from Gulating Vestkanten, Bergen. Pours a clear light golden body with a small white head. Nose is huge catty herbal notes, tomato plant, citrus and hints of grass, red fruits and cereals. Taste is red fruits, catty herbal tones, greenhouse plants and hints of straw and cereals. Light body, medium to high carbonation. Too catty for me, but otherwise a drinkable enough hoppy thirst-quencher.
Bottle. Pours light golden with light low to none head. A big hop nose of mango and citrus. Softly carbonated. Light bodied and very hop forward. An easy drinker with a very dry finish.

This is a great session beer for a summer day. Its moderately yet well hopped. The color is a slightly hazy (unfiltered) golden straw colored. The palate is a little thin for my taste, but this also makes it drink relatively easier, especially when in the heat at the festival it was brewed for. Definitely a strong sessionable beer.
Fantastisk plenklipper øl. God aroma fra humlen. Bra friskhet. og fin bitterhet i ettersmaken..

25.05 2016, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Tiny bubbly shortlasting head, hazy. Aroma is grassy, leafs, moss, old lawn, hay, hops, bark, minerals, sap, flowers, weeds, hints of rubber. Taste is dry grassy, weeds, bark, old lawn, hay, harsh hops, minerals, moss, leafs, flowers, sap, paper, pine needles. Medium bitterness, dry and watery mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Kind of boring.
